I was told that the technical department would look into my claim and respond within 24-48 hours. That was 3 days ago, I have not been contacted.

This company is completely useless. They wanted me to send them a screenshot of my bank statement in order to approve my order. Setting aside the security concerns associated with that, I'm operating in a third world country from a mobile phone. A screenshot with detailed bank statement information isn't even an options. When I responded to their e-mail I got auto replies that just kept saying the same thing over and over. When they finally called me, I got a service rep who barely spoke understandable English and just kept saying "we need screenshot" no matter how many times I tried to explain to her there was no way to do that. Their people aren't empowered to solve problems, they automate too many things, and ultimately they weren't usable, which is a shame since I have a lot of money to spend on top-up minutes as rewards for people. DO NOT recommend.

Review.Titre: Great solution for expats or frequent travelers
Review.Contenu: When I started using TopUp 9 months ago, it was a bit of a nightmare getting my card authorized. I’m an expat, so there were always lengthy delays with verification, and often the transactions were outright rejected. Since jumping that hurdle, it has been 100% smooth sailing. Love the ease of it, though I do wonder when I’ll get a coupon code for being a good client. I have five numbers on my profile so pony up, TopUp! Highly recommended for fair exchange rates, too!

Hi, i find TopUp.com very reliable, a little expensive but trustworthy. They gave qn offer of 5% discount but it had a very fast expiry date so when i used it... not much later it had expired... A suggestion that it would be nice just to gain credits over time that could be used... a little like kobo bonus points or frequent flier points..... that possibly would give a fairer discount. Thanks.

Review.Titre: Over charged two $5.99 topups, then two $1.50 charges also.
Review.Contenu: $1.50 extra for each $5.00 buy plus .99 for each is crazy. That is $2.49 for each $5.00 time purchased.REFUND my $3.00, otherwise Topup has been great!My bank locked my credit card because of these extra charges because they caught it as a fraud.Follow Up: I have been using Topup for more than a year for 3 phones here in Costa Rica. Using same credit card with no changes, so why all of sudden would they need a pre-authorization on every purchase. 2 weeks later and still no refund. It is only a lousy $3.00, but is just a matter of principal.Finally refunded my money, so guess I will use them again.

My transactions always go very smoothly. The credit is always applied within minutes.

TopUp.com provides a fast and straightforward service for topping up mobile phones and utilities. I recently ordered a mobile top up through their website and was very pleased with the speed and ease of the process.As soon as I entered my mobile number and selected the amount I wanted to top up, the payment process was quick and secure through their checkout page. Within about 10 seconds, I received a confirmation text and the top up amount was credited to my mobile account balance.The whole process took less than a minute and was simple to complete on their user-friendly website. I would highly recommend them for anyone looking for a fast and hassle-free way to top up their mobile phone balance.
